replies.body:
Oh I see, I thought you were trying to bash me.

How did your hack work, did you edit most of the MC code, or did you implement a module system? I made a module system, then I edited the Entity Velocity packet to check if the KB modifier was enabled, and if so,I would times the x, y, and z velocities by the modifier.

replies.body:
That's really wrong lol.
This thing is called ping. Lego hits him on his screen but the guy turns red only when the server gets the information that lego hit him and till the info comes back to lego's computer. 
This video is completely legit and I see nothing sketchy in that, it's avicus CTH lol

replies.body: I never said his hitbox changed. If you'd look in 0.25x speed before what you screenshotted you can see lego did aim at him and the sword swinged, though the guy turned red only couple of time after because of ping. The guy flew really high because of CTH's fast hit glitch, which makes one hit register wayy to many times than it needs to

replies.body:
Complete autism,

If you analyzed the video properly you'd know he just landed 1 hit inside the hitbox and then the rest outside of it meaning there's no delay since the only hit he landed inside of it registered inmediately while the other 3-4 were completely off target.

I'm not accusing him of hacks cause I'm aware of the issues in CTH but I'm pretty sure he's been autoclicking for sometime now. If you really knew how autoclickers work I'd assume you know autoclickers let you hit someone nearly outside the hitbox.

1. KB modifiers
